The food and Drug Administration has expanded approval of an H. P. V. vaccine to include people aged twenty seventh through forty five as NPR's Richard Harris reports that had previously been approved for children and young adults
The H ... vaccine Gardasil nine protects people from nine different types of human papillomavirus a sexually transmitted virus that can cause cervical cancer and genital warts it's recommended for people before they become sexually active
The FDA says it's quite effective in adults twenty seven to forty five years old who have not already been infected expanding the approved age range means it can be useful for adults who become sexually active with new partners later in life
The CDC says fourteen million Americans get infected with H. P. V. every year and four thousand women die from cervical cancer caused by this virus Richard Harris NPR News
